title: Competitive Ruling: DT Papa Chau, ENX k3soju, ENX Impactful
body: On June 10, we conducted a sweep of accounts to check for Account Sharing and Elo Boosting.  On June 16, a secondary sweep was conducted that resulted in additional account bans.  The two sweeps included accounts belonging to John "Papa Chau" Le, Michael “k3soju” Zhang, and Josh “Impactful” Mabrey.  All three players’ accounts were found to be in violation of rules concerning Elo Boosting. Papa Chau and k3soju were both found to have been boosting for a brief period, while Impactful was found to have boosted significantly more than the other two players.

Wait, is elo boosting still illegal considering you can just do it by grouping into a premade?   I thought DQ made this a moot point.
This is specifically someone else using your account and you paying them to boost your account. Read.
Dou and premade aren't elo boosting. That's having help from better players to help you climb the elo ladder. Boosting is having others do it for you on your account.

Can people get boosted via premades? Yes. But the amount they can get boosted by is limited. Elo boosting can result in a much higher amount of boosting and hurts the boosted player's teammates regardless of if they are in a premade or not. Theoretically, each ranked match is balanced in terms of overall skill among each team. Thus one team may be 2 gold 5 and 3 silver 3 while their opponent team may be 4 silver 1 and a silver 2. While the silver 2 might be facing a gold 5 in lane and be theoretically at a disadvantage, the teams overall are balanced. When you play in a premade, this doesn't affect finding opponents whose teamwide skill averages out to be the same as that of your premade team. When elo boosting though, you could have a diamond or a challenger that is factored in as a gold or bronze because the balancing program used by the game doesn't realize it isn't the gold or silver player using their account. Thus the teams are not theoretically balanced the way they would be in a premade and the team with the elo-booster is at a large advantage.
I say "theoretically" with all this because anyone who has played a decent number of ranked games knows that some matches are well balanced and others are most definitely not balanced.

If that doesn't make it completely clear, let me give you a theoretical scenario for each below (top, jungle, mid, bot, sup):
premade scenario
bronze 2 vs silver 4, bronze 1 vs silver 3, silver 4 vs bronze 1, silver 4 vs bronze 2, silver 5 vs bronze 3
boosted scenario
diamond4 (seen as bronze 2 by matchmaking/balancing program) vs silver 4, bronze 1 vs silver 3, silver 4 vs bronze 1, silver 4 vs bronze 2, platinum 2 (seen as silver 5) vs bronze 3

Thus the silver 4 in toplane is actually at a SERIOUS disadvantage when they should have a decent advantage according to matchmaking/balancing. Similarly, the bronze 3 support is at a HUGE disadvantage when they should only have a MINOR disadvantage. That's how elo boosting differs from premades.
